definition: to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)
car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159

sentences.english: Sometimes you don't want an amphibious vehicle to look too much like a car.
sentences.chinese: 有时候你不想要一辆太像普通车的两栖车。

sentences.english: I'd like to rent three standard bikes.
With conventional cars, this is pretty much true.
sentences.chinese: 对普通车而言这是很现实的。

sentences.english: Do you like to take a local train or an express?
sentences.chinese: 你想坐普通车还是快车？

definition: car/vehicle/CL:輛|辆[liang4]/machine/to shape with a lathe/Kangxi radical 159
green train (slow, noisy, unairconditioned train with forest green livery and yellow trim that ran on the Chinese railway system from the 1950s, phased out in the early 21st century)
local bus or train/slow train with many stops
power car/multiple-unit train (abbr. for 動車組|动车组)
train or coach service ("service" as in "they run 12 services per day between the two cities")
bus/abbr. for 公共汽車|公共汽车[gong1 gong4 qi4 che1]/car belonging to an organization and used by its members (government car, police car, company car etc)/abbr. for 公務用車|公务用车[gong1 wu4 yong4 che1]
